grain.description: Low in total nitrogen, well modified, high in enzymes, and easily converts with a single step infusion mash. Light, clean, smooth flavor.
grain.name: Rahr 2-Row Malt

grain.description: Easily converts with a single infusion mash. Produces orange tinged golden wort with a unique rich, slightly nutty flavor.
grain.name: Crisp Maris Otter

hops.description: Originally bred in Hull, Germany, Herkules is a descendant of Hallertau and Hull primarily used for bittering.
hops.name: German Herkules

yeast.description: AKA Chico Ale Yeast. yeast 1056 American Ale is used commercially for several classic American ales. This wyeast nutrient strain ferments dry, finishes soft, smooth and clean, and is very well balanced.
yeast.name: Wyeast 1056 American Ale

hops.description: Calypso, with its versatile, evolving character and markedly smooth bittering makes for incredible beer across a range of styles. Fruity notes add crisp flavor to Pale Ales and IPAs, yet an overall complex profile adds depth to Stouts, British Bitters and especially Barleywines.  High in alpha acids and brimming with a flavor-aroma combination all its own, Calypso is a beguiling dual-purpose hop that begs for experimentation.
hops.name: Calypso

hops.description: Despite its upbringing estranged from the IPA cool kids, Jarrylo™ offers complex fruit flavors that make for a very unique Pale Ale and blend seamlessly into an IPA. Indeed, this is how commercial brewers have chosen to use it.
hops.name: Jarrylo™

yeast.description: Wyeast 1272 American Ale II is fruitier and more flocculant than Wyeast 1056, slightly nutty, soft, clean, slightly tart finish.
yeast.name: Wyeast 1272 American Ale II
